title: Hospital Admission H&P - CHF Exacerbation
author: Dr. Emily Brown

sections.chiefComplaint: Shortness of breath and leg swelling for 3 days
sections.historyOfPresentIllness:
Mr. Morrison is a 72-year-old male with a history of heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF, EF 30-35%), Type 2 diabetes mellitus, chronic kidney disease stage 3b, and atrial fibrillation on warfarin who presents with progressive dyspnea on exertion and bilateral lower extremity edema over the past 3 days.

Patient reports he was in his usual state of health until 3 days ago when he noticed increasing difficulty breathing when walking short distances. He normally can walk 1-2 blocks without stopping but now becomes short of breath after 20-30 feet. He also noticed that his legs have become progressively more swollen, and his shoes no longer fit comfortably. He denies any recent dietary indiscretions but admits to running out of his furosemide for the past 5 days due to a lapse in prescription refills.

Associated symptoms include orthopnea (now sleeping on 3 pillows vs his usual 2), paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea with 2 episodes over the past 2 nights, and a 5-pound weight gain over the past week. He denies chest pain, palpitations, fever, cough, or productive sputum. No recent illness exposures.

He denies any recent medication changes other than the missed furosemide doses. He has been compliant with his low-sodium diet and fluid restriction prior to this episode.

physicalExam.general: Alert, oriented, appears mildly dyspneic at rest, able to speak in full sentences
physicalExam.heent: Normocephalic, atraumatic. JVP elevated to angle of jaw at 45 degrees.
physicalExam.cardiovascular: Irregularly irregular rhythm, S1 and S2 present, S3 gallop appreciated, 2/6 systolic murmur at apex
physicalExam.respiratory: Bibasilar crackles extending 1/3 up lung fields bilaterally, no wheezes
physicalExam.abdomen: Soft, non-tender, mildly distended, hepatomegaly palpable 3 cm below right costal margin, no ascites appreciated
physicalExam.extremities: 3+ pitting edema bilateral lower extremities to mid-shin, warm, no cyanosis
physicalExam.neurological: Alert and oriented x3, cranial nerves II-XII intact, strength 5/5 in all extremities

labs.bmp: Na 134, K 5.1, Cl 100, CO2 22, BUN 45, Cr 2.4 (baseline 1.8-2.0), Glucose 165

imaging.cxr: Cardiomegaly, bilateral pulmonary vascular congestion, small bilateral pleural effusions, no focal consolidation

diagnostics.ecg: Atrial fibrillation with controlled ventricular response at 88 bpm, left axis deviation, old inferior Q waves, non-specific ST-T changes

assessment.problem: Acute on chronic systolic heart failure exacerbation (HFrEF)
assessment.details: NYHA Class III-IV presentation. Precipitated by diuretic non-compliance. Elevated BNP, evidence of volume overload on exam and CXR.

assessment.problem: Acute kidney injury on CKD Stage 3b
assessment.details: Cr 2.4 from baseline 1.8-2.0. Likely cardiorenal syndrome in setting of CHF exacerbation. Will need to balance diuresis with renal function.
Rate in 90s, likely due to volume overload and sympathetic activation. INR therapeutic.
Glucose 165, will hold metformin in setting of AKI.
Likely type 2 MI (demand ischemia) in setting of CHF exacerbation and tachycardia. No acute coronary syndrome symptoms.

interventions: IV furosemide 80 mg x1 now, then 40 mg IV q12h
Continue carvedilol 12.5 mg BID (hold if HR <60 or SBP <90)
Hold lisinopril given AKI, will reassess with improving renal function
Expect rate to improve with decongestion
Sliding scale insulin for glycemic control
DVT prophylaxis: therapeutic anticoagulation with warfarin

sections.disposition: Admit to telemetry for CHF exacerbation management. Goal is diuresis to dry weight with improvement of symptoms. Will monitor renal function closely. Code status: Full code.
